conbody.p: This appendix describes the tools that are available outside of the Service Manager GUI. Although most provisioning and configuration is done using the Service Manager GUI, the NCC also features tools for other specific tasks.

NCC database is managed using a series of command line tools. The tools may be run by the customer or by the Nokia support personnel. The tools are provided on the AdminCLI pod, a singleton pod specifically for this purpose. A kubectl command will be run by users to gain access to the AdminCLI pod for running these NCC CNF tools and scripts. For example, the following command is used to run the db-stats tool on a pod with name <pod instance name>:kubectl exec -it -n <pod instance name> -- /opt/tpa/bin/db-stats -s all

section.title: Supported tools
section.p:
The following tools are supported:
configure-manual-oos: manually declares a component that is in a geo-redundant deployment out of service.
db-backup: creates a backup of the Aerospike database
db-list: lists the records in the Aerospike database, which is written in a compressed (.gz) files in a JSON format.
db-stats: displays Aerospike database statistics
log-level: provides get/set/reset log levels from the AdminCLI pod to all application servers in the cluster.
network-status: retrieves the heartbeat status on demand.
chf-status: displays status information for this NCC system.
